response.overview: From the depths of a forgotten VHS tape recorded in 1996 comes ǝɹnʇuǝʌp∀ uǝǝʍollɐH s,plǝᴉɟɹɐפ,  a live and improvised reimagining of the classic Halloween television special warped and  mutated through video synthesis and analog video glitch techniques by Montreal artist Rob  Feulner. Garfield and his best frenemy Odie are mangled through a series of VCRs and circuit  bent machinery, leaving a traumatic stain on the otherwise joyous ritual of dressing up, begging  for candy, and being chased around by pirate ghosts. The audio is broken down and reassembled  by Montreal experimental-electronic artist Event Cloak, leaving no soundwave untouched. Bonus:  broadcast commercials included.
response.title: ǝɹnʇuǝʌp∀ uǝǝʍollɐH s,plǝᴉɟɹɐפ
